title: Capacitor - E-field after inserting a dielectric

content.question: A capacitor is isolated from its environment, and within the capacitor there is an electric field of strength <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math>. A dielectric material is then placed inside the capacitor, filling a portion of the space between the plates as shown. Within the dielectric material, an additional electric field is established. How does this new electric field compare to the original field <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math>?

choices.label: It is a weaker field pointed in the opposite direction.
It is a weaker field pointed in the same direction.
It is a stronger field pointed in the opposite direction.
It is a stronger field pointed in the same direction.

content.answer: It is a weaker field pointed in the opposite direction.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
